name: sys::thread_local::native::eager::Storage::<T>::get

core::ptr::null.doc:
Creates a null raw pointer.

 This function is equivalent to zero-initializing the pointer:
 `MaybeUninit::<*const T>::zeroed().assume_init()`.
 The resulting pointer has the address 0.

 # Examples

 ```
 use std::ptr;

 let p: *const i32 = ptr::null();
 assert!(p.is_null());
 assert_eq!(p as usize, 0); // this pointer has the address 0
 ```

doc:
Gets a pointer to the TLS value. If the TLS variable has been destroyed,
 a null pointer is returned.

 The resulting pointer may not be used after thread destruction has
 occurred.

 # Safety
 The `self` reference must remain valid until the TLS destructor is run.
